law.catch_line: A person becomes a member of a limited liability company at:...

text.section:
A person becomes a member of a limited liability company at:
The time the limited liability company is formed;
A later time specified in the operating agreement; or
The time specified in § 4A-902(b)(1) of this title relating to continuation of the limited liability company after there are no remaining members.

After the formation of a limited liability company, a person may be admitted as a member:
In the case of a person acquiring a membership interest directly from the limited liability company, upon compliance with the operating agreement or, if the operating agreement does not so provide, upon the unanimous consent of the members;
In the case of an assignee of the economic interest of a member, only as provided in § 4A-604 of this subtitle; or
In the case of a personal representative or successor to the last remaining member who is not an assignee of the last remaining member, as provided in § 4A-902(b)(1) of this title.

Unless otherwise agreed, a person may be admitted as a member of a limited liability company and may be the sole member of a limited liability company without:
Making a capital contribution to the limited liability company;
Being obligated to make a capital contribution to the limited liability company; or
Acquiring an economic interest in the limited liability company.
